date.headline: Docker Inc. was founded
date.text: by Solomon Hykes and Sebastien Pahl during the Y Combinator Summer 2010 startup incubator group

date.headline: Initial Git Commit
date.text: The initial Git Commit gets pushed to the corresponding Git Repositor

date.headline: Docker debut
date.text: Docker got Published in March 2013 by the company dotCloud at PyCon

asset.caption: yCon US 2013 | Santa Clara, CA | March 13th â€“ March 21st

date.headline: Kubernetes Project
date.text: In July 2014, Microsoft, Red Hat, IBM, Docker, Mesosphere, Core OS and Saltstack joined the Kubernetes project initiated by Google. The aim of the cooperation was to be able to provide Docker containers to all private, public and hybrid cloud environments with Kubernetes.

date.headline: Docker created the Moby project
date.text: The Moby project is a project for open research and development of docker

date.headline: Redhat Enterprise Linux 8 removed Docker
date.text: Redhat Enterprise Linux 8, which was released in 2019, no longer includes Docker because Redhat and other distributors such as B. Suse decided to replace Docker with podman because of problems with Docker Inc.

date.headline: Sold to Mirantis
date.text: Docker Enterprise was sold to Mirantis in 2019 for around $ 35 million. The company subsequently announced that it would end support for Docker Swarm after two years
